intro: Faramea planitiarum, commonly known as the mountain hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the humid forests of Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that range in color from white to deep pink, often with a prominent central stigma. The plant typically grows as an erect shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a velvety texture with a dark green upper surface. Faramea planitiarum thrives in shaded to semi-shaded environments and is often found in lowland and montane regions.
